Show me the latest innovations in Weatherability of Decorative Coatings.
What trends are emerging in the Sustainability of industrial coatings in 2025?
Find recent conferences or Patents discussing Scuff-Resistance in coatings.

Search tags/topics - Product, coating, architectural or similar.

News.title: Chiguard® W-5491: High-Performance Water-Based UV Stabilizer
News.summary: Chitec has launched Chiguard® W-5491, a new high-performance, water-based UV stabilizer. This product is designed to offer advanced protection for wood coatings, addressing the degradation caused by ultraviolet radiation such as fading, yellowing, and structural damage. As a waterborne solution, it aligns with market trends towards more sustainable and environmentally friendly coating formulations. This product innovation is significant for the wood coatings sector, providing a solution to extend the service life of exterior wood applications by preventing UV-induced aging.

News.title: Chitec Sponsors LIS Educational Video for Green Chemistry
News.summary: Chitec has sponsored an educational video by LIS to promote the principles of green chemistry. This initiative reflects the company's commitment to corporate social responsibility and sustainability within the chemical industry. By supporting educational outreach, Chitec aims to foster a better understanding of how green chemistry can lead to the development of more environmentally friendly products, including paints, coatings, and adhesives. This action aligns with their business focus on creating sustainable additives.

News.title: ACA Issues Tech Roadmap for Waterborne Coatings Durability
News.summary: The American Coatings Association (ACA) published its third Technology Roadmap in February 2024, focusing on enhancing the durability and water resistance of waterborne coatings. The report stems from industry-led discussions aimed at identifying key research areas. It notes that tightening regulations on Volatile Organic Compounds (VOCs) and a growing focus on sustainability are driving increased demand for waterborne systems. The roadmap outlines several persistent technical challenges, including managing hydrophilicity, improving film formation under various environmental conditions, extending 'open time' for application, preventing 'flash rust' on metal substrates, and ensuring freeze-thaw stability. To address these issues, the report offers seven core recommendations. Key suggestions include the development of more accurate, non-destructive testing methods to better predict real-world performance; research into higher crosslink density and two-component (2K) waterborne systems for more demanding applications; and the pursuit of greater system robustness through novel resins, additives, and surfactants. The roadmap also advocates for updating product specifications to be performance-based rather than chemistry-specific, and calls for better training and awareness programs to promote proper application and share success stories.

News.title: 2025 CEO Forum: Industry Leaders on Market Trends and Future Growth
News.summary: In a forum featuring CEOs from leading global coatings companies, leaders shared insights on 2024 performance and the outlook for 2025. Participants included executives from AkzoNobel, BASF, Benjamin Moore, Berger Paints, Hempel, HMG Paints, Mäder Group, Sinteplast, and Vitex. The consensus on 2024 was a year of mixed market conditions and varied regional performance, with geopolitical tensions and macroeconomic instability cited as key challenges. For instance, AkzoNobel saw solid growth despite weakness in China's decorative paint market, while Berger Paints reported high single-digit volume growth. Looking to 2025, most companies are not expecting a significant market rebound and are focusing on strategies like cost efficiency, operational improvements, and portfolio management. Key growth opportunities identified include marine and powder coatings (AkzoNobel), infrastructure and energy sectors (Hempel), construction chemicals (Berger Paints), and water-based technologies (HMG Paints). A major recurring theme was the increasing demand for sustainable and eco-friendly solutions. R&D efforts are heavily focused on this area, with companies developing coatings for green energy applications like EV batteries, low-bake systems, and integrating bio-based or recycled raw materials to meet customer and regulatory demands for a reduced environmental footprint.

News.title: AkzoNobel CEO on 2025 Growth and Portfolio Strategy
News.summary: AkzoNobel CEO Greg Poux-Guillaume reported solid organic growth in 2024, with mixed market conditions. The Decorative Paints business saw strong performance in Latin America and South East Asia, but faced significant weakness in China. Performance Coatings delivered solid results, driven by Marine, Protective, and Powder Coatings, though some industrial demand softened late in the year. The company does not anticipate a significant market rebound in 2025, forecasting flat to low single-digit growth driven by Marine, Powder, and emerging Decorative markets. AkzoNobel's strategy focuses on cost efficiency, operational improvements, and active portfolio management, identifying businesses to invest in and others that may have better owners. R&D efforts are centered on sustainability-driven innovation, such as low-bake powder coatings and bisphenol-free can coatings. Regarding tariffs, the company notes they generate additional costs and force supply chain modifications, which ultimately get reflected in pricing.

News.title: BASF Coatings Division Head on Automotive and Industrial Markets
News.summary: Uta Holzenkamp, President of BASF's Coatings Division, stated that despite a 2% decrease in global vehicle production, the division achieved solid results in 2024, comparable to the previous year. The company compensated for lower automotive volumes with increased sales in the surface technology sector. For 2025, BASF anticipates continued economic and geopolitical uncertainties and moderate volume growth. Growth strategies include leveraging their position in China's automotive OEM market, gaining share in the value-for-money refinish segment, and diversifying the surface treatment business into aerospace and coil. R&D is heavily focused on sustainability and digitalization, developing solutions like low-bake automotive OEM coatings and biomass-balanced refinish products to help customers reduce their carbon footprint. The company emphasizes local production to mitigate potential tariff impacts, noting the vast majority of its U.S. sales come from products manufactured in the country.

News.title: Benjamin Moore CEO Discusses Architectural Coatings Market
News.summary: Dan Calkins, CEO of Benjamin Moore, described 2024 as being impacted by fluctuating mortgage rates and a weaker housing market, though the industry fared better than in 2023. The company anticipates growth in the year ahead, particularly in residential repaint, as new home construction and sales of existing homes are expected to increase. The business strategy remains focused on its 140-year goal of manufacturing premium paint and beautiful colors, while championing sustainability and supporting the independent channel. R&D efforts are centered on creating quality products that exceed rigorous environmental and performance criteria for VOCs, emissions, and durability. Calkins noted it is too early to determine the impact of proposed tariffs, but the company will monitor the situation. Benjamin Moore plans to launch new product introductions in the coming weeks.

News.title: Berger Paints CEO on Growth in India and Strategic Pillars
News.summary: Abhijit Roy, CEO of Berger Paints, reported high single-digit volume growth in 2024, despite demand headwinds and increased competition in the Indian market. The industrial and protective coatings segments performed well, while decorative paints saw muted value growth following a 5% price decrease. Roy identified significant growth potential in protective and general industrial coatings, spurred by India's infrastructure ramp-up and the 'Make in India' initiative. Construction chemicals, waterproofing, and wood coatings are also key growth drivers. The company's strategy for 2025 is anchored on five pillars: expanding distribution, building strong brands, innovating products (e.g., eco-friendly solutions), managing costs with technology, and retaining talent. R&D is focused on nanotechnology, coatings for green energy (EV batteries, solar), and cost optimization. Since the U.S. is not an export market, proposed tariffs are not expected to have a direct impact.

News.title: Hempel CEO on Strategy, Growth, and R&D Focus
News.summary: Michael Hansen, CEO of Hempel, noted that global macroeconomic instability impacted the coatings market in 2024, with challenges from subdued construction, low consumer confidence, and geopolitical tensions. Despite this, Hempel continued to follow its 'Double Impact' growth strategy. The company's focus is on building leadership positions in marine, decorative, infrastructure, and energy sectors in selected geographies. Growth will be driven by technology and innovation, supported by a new technology function established in 2024 that combines R&D, procurement, and sustainability. The strategy for 2025 involves driving innovation, digitalization, and operational scalability to enhance profitability and better serve customers. R&D is focused on developing differentiating, sustainable solutions that help customers reduce their environmental impact, such as by minimizing resource use and extending asset lifetimes. The company's resilient business model is designed to mitigate potential impacts from trade tariffs.

News.title: HMG Paints COO on Innovation and UK Market Position
News.summary: Steve Crossman, COO of HMG Paints, described 2024 as a positive year with increased demand and new partnerships. The company launched numerous innovative products, expanding its water-based and specialist portfolios. A key growth opportunity is in water-based technologies across all markets, driven by a growing focus on sustainability. The company's R&D team is collaborating with suppliers and customers to develop the next generation of coatings that meet environmental targets without compromising performance. As a UK-based manufacturer, HMG is mindful of potential tariff impacts but focuses on flexibility and proactive supply chain management to mitigate them. The long-term strategy is to maintain its position as the UK's leading independent paint manufacturer through continuous innovation, expansion into new markets, and investment in infrastructure and personnel. This includes a commitment to developing the next wave of talent within the company.

News.title: Mäder Group CEO on Strategy in Challenging Economic Climate
News.summary: Julien Molina, CEO of Mäder Group, stated that 2024 remained an economically challenging year, with project postponements and declines in industrial activity. However, the company views market consolidation as an opportunity. The Ë-Volve strategic plan delivered progress, reinforcing CSR and decarbonization commitments, earning an EcoVadis Gold certification. Strategic segments for growth include mobility and energy, with an expanding focus on lifestyle segments. The company's 2025 strategy will reinforce its distinct market positioning by developing innovative products aligned with customer needs and environmental efficiency. R&D efforts are resolutely focused on solutions that respect human health and the environment, shifting towards sustainable chemistry. Molina expects the global landscape to remain uncertain, potentially causing increases in raw material costs, particularly epoxies, but not to post-COVID levels.

News.title: Sinteplast CEO on Argentinian Market and Sustainability
News.summary: Claudio Rodriguez, CEO of Sinteplast, described 2024 as a challenging year in Argentina due to political transformations and economic adjustments, which led to a decrease in sales. However, the company adapted and sees a significant recovery ahead. The company's growth strategy is focused on leveraging innovation and consolidating its market leadership in Argentina while expanding in Brazil, Uruguay, Paraguay, and Bolivia. A key focus is sustainability; R&D efforts are dedicated to creating products that are not only effective but also environmentally friendly. A recent example is the launch of Recuplast atérmico, an athermic, reflecting, and waterproofing membrane in Argentina that reduces energy consumption. While acknowledging that global tariffs can affect raw material costs, Rodriguez remains optimistic, citing the company's 66 years of experience navigating economic changes in Argentina.

News.title: Vitex CEO on Growth, Transformation, and R&D in Europe
News.summary: Armodios Yannidis, CEO of Vitex, reported that despite slower consumer demand for architectural paint in Southeast Europe due to inflation in 2024, the company achieved 18% sales growth, driven by projects business, ETICS products, and exports. The company has declared 2025 the 'year of transformation,' with a significant investment program maturing. This includes a new ERP and CRM, a new production facility for ETICS, and a new warehouse and logistics center. The highest volume growth is expected to continue from its ETICS segment. R&D is focused on three areas: sustainable products using bio-based/recycled materials, climate-resilient coatings, and smart paints (photocatalytic, antimicrobial). Yannidis expressed concern over TiO2 tariffs, noting that if demand recovers, EU producers will be at a significant disadvantage, though Vitex's strong relationships with European suppliers provide some confidence.

Conference.title: Chitec Technology Shines at 2025 PMT
Conference.summary: Chitec Technology is highlighting its participation in the 2025 PMT event. The company is a key player in the production of specialty chemicals for the coatings, adhesives, and plastics industries, and this event serves as a platform to showcase their latest innovations. Their product portfolio includes UV stabilizers (Chiguard®), photoinitiators (R-gen®/Chivacure®), antioxidants (Deox/Revenox®), and flame retardants. This participation underscores their commitment to advancing technology in UV/LED curing, printing, and other high-performance applications within the coatings sector.

Conference.title: Chitec Technology to Exhibit at the 2025 PMT
Conference.summary: Chitec Technology has announced it will be an exhibitor at the 2025 PMT conference. This serves as a formal announcement preceding the event itself. The company will present its range of additives, which are crucial for the coatings, adhesives, and sealants industries. Exhibiting at the event allows Chitec to engage directly with industry professionals and demonstrate how their UV stabilizers, photoinitiators, and antioxidants can be integrated into advanced coating formulations to improve durability and performance.

Conference.title: Chitec Showcases Sustainability at Chinaplas 2025
Conference.summary: Chitec Technology showcased its sustainability initiatives and product developments at Chinaplas 2025. The company emphasized its theme of “Sustainable Additives, Better Future,” presenting solutions relevant to the coatings and plastics industries. This participation highlights the growing importance of environmental responsibility in the chemical industry, with Chitec positioning its portfolio of additives as key enablers for creating more sustainable end-products, including coatings with lower environmental impact.

Conference.title: Chitec Presents “Sustainable Additives, Better Future” at ECS 2025
Conference.summary: At the European Coatings Show (ECS) 2025, Chitec promoted its vision of “Sustainable Additives, Better Future.” The company presented its latest innovations for the paint and coatings industry, focusing on products that enhance performance while meeting stringent environmental standards. The ECS is a premier event for the global coatings industry, and Chitec's participation signals its active role in driving the sector towards more sustainable practices through advanced chemical additives.

Conference.title: Chitec Technology to Showcase Latest Innovations at 2025 ChinaPlas
Conference.summary: Chitec Technology announced its participation in the 2025 ChinaPlas exhibition, where it will showcase its latest chemical innovations. This event is a major platform for the plastics and rubber industries, with significant overlap with the coatings sector through applications in plastic coatings and adhesives. Chitec's presence allows them to introduce new UV stabilizers, antioxidants, and other additives to a broad audience of manufacturers and researchers, reinforcing their position as an innovation leader.

Conference.title: Chitec at 2025 SPE International Polyolefins Conference
Conference.summary: Chitec Technology participated in the 2025 SPE International Polyolefins Conference. While focused on polyolefins, this event is relevant to the coatings industry as these materials are often coated for protection, decoration, or functional purposes. Chitec's additives, such as UV stabilizers and antioxidants, are critical for improving the durability and performance of both the plastic substrates and the coatings applied to them. Their participation highlights the synergistic relationship between polymer science and coating technology.
